intro: Peucedanum brandegeei, commonly known as the Armenian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and prefers well-drained, rocky soils. Its seeds are small and oval, often dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution in its native habitat.
